title: Elton John claims George Michael died because he couldn't deal with his sexuality
text:

Sir Elton John has claimed George Michael died because he could not deal with his sexuality.

Even though coroners ruled the Wham! star cause of death was a "dilated cardiomyopathy with myocarditis and fatty liver.", the Sacrifice singer insists his friend "didn’t want" to live any longer.

Elton, 72, added he agreed with fellow recovering addict Ozzy Osbourne that Michael did not “want to be here” as he battled his emotions and drug demons.

Elton's brutal assessment came as he expressed his dismay at being unable to help his close friend.

Michael, who died on Christmas Day three years ago, ducked away from getting help despite several efforts from the singer-songwriter to help him into rehab in the final decade of his life.

(Image: Getty)

Elton reflected on being unable to save Michael in the same way he did for Robbie Williams and Donatella Versace.

He admitted: “He couldn’t get it, George. And he resented the fact that I had hinted that maybe he change his life a little bit and he’d be happier if he tried something else.

"The person has actually got to want it. It’s like me in the end; I really wanted it. I had two alternatives: one, to die, and one to live, and I wanted to live. But that’s the difference if you want it, and poor George didn’t want it.”

Elton confessed his shock feelings as he spoke to close friend Sharon Osbourne on US TV show The Talk.

Recalling the Careless Whisper star’s death, he told her: “I remember talking to you the day he died on Christmas Day, and I phoned you, and I was in Aspen and Ozzy got on the phone, and he said, ‘He didn’t want to be here.’ And I thought that’s the most succinct apt thing: he didn’t want to be here.

(Image: Getty)

"He was so uncomfortable in his skin about being gay even though he said he wasn’t.”

Elton admitted: “We all make terrible mistakes, and some of us are addicts when we are born, and we have to battle that addiction, but you can turn the corner and you can get help and it’s been the most wonderful decision I’ve made.”

He then appeared to take a subtle swipe at the singer’s former live-in lover and last partner Fadi Fawaz as he likened his battle to get clean with Michael.

"Part of your recovery was helping people who wanted help,” he said, “but also, other people around me didn’t want me to be sober: my mother, my personal assistant, my manager, because they lost control, or they began to lose control. But yeah, the whole point of sobriety is that when you get sober, you help other people. It’s a fellowship.”

Elton recalled how he saved fashion designer Donatella Versace from losing her life through addiction.

(Image: Getty)

He added: “If Donatella can get sober and I can get sober, then anyone can get sober.

“Donatella came to a concert and we knew she had a problem and she would dodge me like a bullet because she didn’t want me to see her and she was in a terrible state.

“And I said, ‘She ‘s ready.’

“She’s come here and she was crying, but it was a cry for help. And I said,‘Let’s do it. She’s ready.’

“And it was a hilarious event because it was not normal. She’s sitting there in a $100,000 ball gown, and she resisted slightly and she went. It was very funny. She was like, ‘I will come, but I don’t want any oily food.’ But she’s been sober ever since.”

In May 2017, Darren Salter, senior coroner for the county of Oxfordshire, said a post-mortem has found that the singer died of "dilated cardiomyopathy with myocarditis and fatty liver."

Dilated cardiomyopathy is a condition in which the left ventricle of the heart becomes stretched and weakened, limiting the heart's ability to pump blood.

Myocarditis is inflammation of the heart muscle.

The former Wham! singer was found dead at his country home in Goring, Oxfordshire. He was 53.

Michael only revealed he was gay after he was arrested in Beverly Hills in 1998 when he was 34 years old.

The arrest, by an undercover cop in a public toilet, led to him being charged with 'lewd behaviour' and handed a $500 fine, as well as 80 hours of community service.
description: EXCLUSIVE: Sir Elton, 72, said his friend 'didn't want' to live any longer when he passed away on Christmas Day 2016
